title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: increased security planned for scampton airshow .
county has most knee and hip osteoarthritis cases in east midlands .
crowds expected at burghley horse trials in county .
man charged with murder over mablethorpe death .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me and the team for another week , we 'll have more from 08:00 on monday .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good weekend .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: here 's peter levy with tonight 's headlines on look north :
tonight 's headlines with @ twitterid - more at 1830
build a foot bridge , not difficult we have two in welton & melton , wow over the a63
all the events on the marina have out grown that area time to move events to other areas of hull city centre & parks in hull many thanks
move freedom to another area it will stop traffic issues !
it has out grown the marina now make it bigger & better for everyone
hi peter the traffic problems on castle street very bad move the freedom event off marina to other areas of hull town will stop the traffic
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather this evening
text: evening showers will fade away after dusk , with clear spells expected overnight .
it will become cool towards dawn .
light and variable winds a few mist and fog patches will form .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: how do you know summer 's nearly over ? lincolnshire gritters prepare for winter
text: the sun may still be shining , but gritters in lincolnshire are already preparing for the winter season .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: traffic and travel : crash on the a46
text: traffic is slow between lincoln and newark , there 's been a crash causing a problem on lanes in both directions .
it 's happened on the stretch between the a616 great north road turnoff and the b6166 farndon road turnoff .
allow for some extra time if you 're heading that way .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: traffic and travel : b1188 reopen
text: traffic is now back to normal on the b1188 after a crash closed the road in branston earlier .
several vehicles were involved .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: offenders hooked in illegal fishing clampdown
text: the environment agency has been clamping down on illegal fishing in lincolnshire .
enforcement officers carried out 180 spot checks earlier this month along the river witham , to ensure that everyone had a licence and rules were being observed .
officers said 15 anglers have now been served with notices for fishing offences .
peter haslock from the environment agency says there 's a good reason why they make sure people have a licence :
the money from licences helps to pay for improving fish stocks and maintaining the environment and rivers that are so important to the hobby ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: spoil heap to be removed in grimsby
text: developers of a site on humberston avenue in grimsby have promised to remove a spoil heap , after complaints from people living locally .
initially steps were taken to cover the spoil heap , but it has now been decided to remove it after people living nearby said it ruined the outlook for certain properties .
local mp martin vickers says he 's pleased the developers have listened to the concerns of people .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: lincoln knights prepare to go off into the sunset
text: they 've become a bit of a fixture in lincoln over the summer but this weekend is your last chance to see the lincoln knights .
the 36 painted figures were placed earlier this year to mark the 800th anniversary of the battle of lincoln .
they 'll be on show until sunday .
some were vandalised and then repaired and one was even thrown in the river :
but despite a bit of unchivalrous behaviour towards the knights organisers say the trail has been a great success .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : b1188 closed in branston
text: the b1188 is closed in branston after a crash involving several vehicles .
all the emergency services are at the scene but police say it does n't look as though anyone is seriously hurt .
expect delays if you 're heading through the village though .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: america leads the dressage at burghley horse trials
text: as day two of dressage continues , there are five british competitors in the top 10 places at the moment , all chasing laura kieffer who 's on 37.0 penalty points on veronica ii .
she 's taken the lead from overnight frontman michael jung from germany .
he was way out in front on 38.9 on his mount la biosthetique sam fbw , with the uk 's gemma tattersall now in third place on 43.0 on arctic soul and izzy taylor in fourth on 45.6 on trevidden .
the highest placed rider from the east midlands is willa newton from melton mowbray on 47.0 penalty points with chance remark .
she currently lies in 10th place .
author: Lisa Teanby
BBC Sport

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather this afternoon
text: after a cool , but bright start to the day any early mist or fog patches will clear with sunny spells following .
scattered showers will develop , these perhaps becoming locally heavy during the afternoon .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: high level of security at scampton airshow
text: the organisers of scampton airshow say there will be tight security at the event next weekend .
airport style checkpoints , armed officers and random vehicle checks will all be used .
security has changed in response to recent terror events .
supt phil vickers of lincolnshire police says there will be a greater visibility of officers to put people at ease :
there 's an element of increase , it 'll be more overt with armed officers on patrol ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: two jaguarundi coming to lincolnshire zoo
text: do you know what a jaguarundi is ?
until about five minutes ago neither did i , but ark wildlife park and rescue zoo in stickney is about to get two of them !
this is what they look like :
they 're small wild cats native to south america and you 'll be able to see them yourself at the wildlife park from 9 september .
the park says despite the name they 're actually closer to pumas than jaguars .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : rail strike
text: replacement bus services are in operation in lincolnshire because of a railway workers strike .
the rmt union says the strikes are over safety concerns and driver-only trains .
buses will serving the routes between lincoln and retford instead .
the strikes are set to continue on monday so a similar replacement service will still be in effect .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lincolnshire has most hip and knee osteoarthritis cases in east midlands
text: lincolnshire has the most cases of knee and hip osteoarthritis in the east midlands .
there are 68,000 people with the condition in their knees and 40,000 people in their hips .
dr vel sakthivel is an orthopaedic surgeon at lincoln county hospital and he says it can affect people of all ages .
getting older is n't the cause .
i 've seen it in 30-year-olds , i 've seen healthy joints in 80-year-olds .
so while it often goes hand-in-hand it 's not always the only reason ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby film highlighting addiction to go nationwide
text: the stories of people from north east lincolnshire who have come through drug and alcohol addictions are going to be shared with others across the uk .
a film submitted by the foundations service , which is based in grimsby , has been short-listed for a national award .
it tells the story of some of their peer mentors , who have come through addictions themselves and now work to help others .
it will now be shown to similar organisations around the country .
this is the first time we have ever done anything like this .
the first time we came across it we thought it was a really good idea to get some people to talk about the steps in their recovery ''
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: murder charge man remanded in custody
text: a man has appeared in court charged with murder after a fatal stabbing in mablethorpe .
james patrick adam , aged 46 , of victoria road , mablethorpe was remanded in custody by magistrates in lincoln to appear at the city 's crown court this afternoon .
police have now released this of 36-year-old james rudd , who died after the incident on bank holiday monday in mablethorpe .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : traffic back to normal on the a1
text: the crash we told you about earlier has now been cleared and all lanes are open as normal .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: breakingman charged with murder over mablethorpe death
text: a man has been charged with the murder of 36-year-old james rudd , who died after being stabbed in mablethorpe on monday .
james patrick adam , 46 , of victoria road , will appear before lincoln magistrates ' court later this morning .
mr rudd died at the scene after the incident on victoria road which happened just after 13:00 .
a man has been charged but the investigation continues and it is very important that we speak to every potential witness .
i am appealing to anyone with information , no matter how insignificant they think it may be , to contact us .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : a1 lane closure after long bennington crash
text: there 's been a crash on the a1 near long bennington this morning involving three vehicles , one of them a chicken lorry .
the southbound lane is closed and , as you might expect , traffic is already building up so try and avoid the area if you can .
the police are n't yet sure when the road will reopen .
no-one has been taken to hospital .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: the weather this morning
text: it 's a cool but bright start to the day with any fog or mist patches soon clearing .
here 's my full weather forecast :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: good morning , welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln .
alex here , ready to bring you all the very latest from across the county .
we 'll have news , travel , sport and weather updates throughout the day until 18:00 .
is there something we should know about ?
let us know by getting in touch through email , facebook or twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: thwarted smuggler hid five in cupboards
text: thwarted smuggler hid five in cupboards

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: well that 's it from me today , we 'll have more news , sport , weather and travel from across the county as it happens tomorrow from 08.00 .
for now i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather this evening
text: scattered heavy and perhaps thundery showers will die out this evening to give a dry night with some clear spells .
becoming chilly in rural areas with the odd mist or fog patch by dawn .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: our headlines on look north tonight
text: here are the headlines from bbc look north tonight .
tune in from 18.30 on bbc one .
tonight 's headlines from @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: images of scunthorpe people smuggler released
text: the home office has released images of a man from scunthorpe who was sentenced to three and a half years in jail for people smuggling .
huzaifi hasan musa , 22 , of mary street , scunthorpe , was caught after the van he was driving was stopped by border force officers in france .
five iraqi nationals , including one child , were found hidden in cabinets .
uk border force says people like musa put vulnerable lives at risk .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: grantham racing driver tackles silverstone
text: this weekend lincolnshire-based racing driver shaun balfe is competing at silverstone .
this weekend he 's in the gt3 category in a mclaren car .
the first race is on saturday at 15:15 and the second at 13:15 bst on sunday .
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: bbmf hopeful for air tests next week
text: the battle of britain memorial flight say they hope to start air testing their aircraft next week .
several aircraft were grounded earlier this month because of safety fears over a faulty gear found in one of their merlin engines .
their engines have had to be stripped down and inspected because of a problem with a pinion gear .
specialists teams have been working at raf coningsby to fix the problem .

the team as ever have been fantastic and we 've worked in partnership with retro who are the company which service all our engines and of course rolls royce who are the original people who designed this engine ''
author: Chris Berrow
Presenter

documents.title: thousands attend burghley horse trials
text: thousands of people have headed to burghley house near stamford for the first day of burghley horse trials .
as well as seeing the top eventing riders in the world , visitors have been enjoying the wealth of shopping , food and drink available .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: jimi hendrix 's note to 'awestruck ' teenager up for auction
text: a note jimi hendrix wrote to a young woman on a packet of guitar strings 50 years ago is up for auction .
anthea connell said she was `` awestruck '' when the star spotted her , aged 19 , at boston gliderdrome in lincolnshire in march 1967 .
she had been watching her boyfriend 's band set up when hendrix came over to talk to her , before handing her a note .
it read : `` to anthea - love and kisses to you forever .
i wish i could really talk to you .
stay sweet , jimi hendrix . ''
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: very slow traffic on a17
text: there 's very slow traffic on the a17 in both directions between sleaford road ( beckingham ) and stragglethorpe lane ( brant broughton ) in the roadworks area .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: special police sergeant sacked for sex with vulnerable teenager
text: a volunteer police sergeant has been sacked by lincolnshire police for having sex with a vulnerable teenager .
a hearing was told that corey alvey , who served as a volunteer with the force , had been involved in searching for the teenager who 'd been reported missing .
the hearing was told that alvey , from stamford , managed to make contact with the teenager using snapchat and instagram .
the contact was described as `` inappropriate , personal and unprofessional '' .
the 26-year-old later had sexual intercourse with the teenager .
it is clear that public trust has been seriously damaged by the actions of special sergeant alvey in these circumstances
alvey admitted breaching standards of professional behaviour and a representative at the hearing apologised for his behaviour .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: this afternoon 's headlines
text: top stories this morning from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: patient 's daughter speaks out after rise in serious incidents for emas
text: earlier today we told you that there 's been a rise in the number of incidents where patients have died or been seriously injured while being treated by east midlands ambulance service ( emas ) .
five years ago emas recorded five of the most serious incidents , but in the year to march that number had risen to 27 .
emas says it 's down to an increased workload and a new way of recording incidents .
liz burman from gainsborough was n't happy with how her father was treated following a fall - he died the next day
my father had to lay on the floor and he was n't given any pain medication until we insisted he be given some pain medication because he was in absolute agony for three-and-a-half hours .
an 82-year-old on the floor for three-and-a-half hours ''
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: police looking for man following bike theft in gainsborough
text: lincolnshire police need help identifying this man following a theft on friday 11 august .
a bicycle was removed from outside the heron frozen food store on the market place , gainsborough at 16.00 .
if you have any information please contact the police on 101 .

documents.title: your weather this lunchtime
text: if you 're popping out for a sandwich it 's looking alright out there - cloudy with some sunshine .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: sacked county pc apologises over drinking and driving
text: a lincolnshire police officer 's apologised to the chief constable for drinking and driving .
pc rebecca stevenson told a hearing she was appalled by her own behaviour .
she was off-duty when she crashed a vehicle into a dyke while driving with double the permitted amount of alcohol in her system .
the 33-year-old from louth has been dismissed from the force .
author: David McKenna
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: highways councillor says a17 overtaking lane plan 'is safe '
text: the county council has responded to concerns about the safety of a planned overtaking lane on the a17 .
the lane will run from gedney to long sutton .
local councillors think the road would be dangerous and lead to collisions on the middle lane .
but county councillor richard davies , the man in charge of the region 's highways , says this is not the case :
people seem to think what we 're building is one of these old three lane roads , where you 'd have almost a free for all in the middle lane , that 's not what we 're proposing to build .
what we 're talking about is just in one direction , at the gedney end , is building an extra lane to provide overtaking space .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: transfer deadline day for the imps
text: we understand that lincoln city are set to add a striker to their squad ahead of tonight 's deadline .
the imps ' manager danny cowley has talked about having a fourth forward to challenge matt green , ollie palmer and matt rhead for a place in the starting 11 .
this afternoon 's regular press conference has been moved to tomorrow so that suggests the manager is prioritising getting some deals over the line .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: trains at a halt between nottingham and lincoln central
text: services are at a standstill on east midlands trains between nottingham and lincoln central due to a faulty freight train at newark castle .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: traffic delays in stamford
text: some traffic information for people on their way to burghley horse trials now .
the traffic lights on the bridge over the river welland , a43 , in central stamford have been rephased and this is causing traffic delays , particularly for those travelling south .
it 's being recommending that local traffic takes alternative routes where possible to avoid the bridge .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: burghley horse trials attract world 's top riders
text: it 's the first day of the burghley horse trials .
the four-day event is one of the top eventing competitions in the world , attracting top international riders .
more than 150,000 visitors are expected to come to burghley house near stamford .
hotels are full in stamford this weekend , as the annual influx begins .

some of the world 's top three-day-eventers are here - including three members of team gb 's gold medal winning team from the european championship eventing - nicola wilson , tina cook and oliver townend .
there 's a top prize of £ 90,000 for this year 's winner .

but not everyone comes for the horses , shopping is also a major attraction - hundreds of shops , trade stands and food stalls have been set up - a lot of money will be spent over the next four days .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: just one day left for cowley 's transfers
text: it 's transfer deadline day and lincoln city manager danny cowley 's hopeful of adding to his squad , with a striker particularly on his mind .
the window slams shut at 23:00 and cowley expects it to be a busy day
we 're still working really hard , i do n't expect to see my children anytime soon .
it 's unfortunate you 're in a chain and that 's what it is and we 're waiting for others to move and when others move maybe we 'll be able to move .
author: Su Whitaker
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: tiny tortoise discovery
text: meet the surprise new arrivals at natureland seal sanctuary in skegness .
these two baby tortoises were spotted by a stunned member of staff in the reptile room .
it 's been 15 years since a tortoise was born at the sanctuary - because their male was stolen , but they do get donations of new tortoises .
they 're thinking of naming them sheldon and amy - after the popular characters on the us tv show the big bang theory .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: some mist and fog patches , in rural areas , will quickly clear , leaving a bright morning .
cloud building into the afternoon with scattered slow-moving showers developing , perhaps heavy and thundery in places .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: rise in serious incidents at east midlands ambulance service
text: there 's been a rise in the number of patients who 've died or been seriously harmed while being treated by the east midlands ambulance service ( emas ) .
they include call-outs which resulted in the unexpected or avoidable death of a patient .
five years ago emas recorded five of the most serious incidents .
but the latest figures show that number had risen to 27 .
they included calls where the ambulance crews misread the symptoms of illnesses like sepsis and heart failure or where defibrillation equipment failed .
in 2013 a man died after the ambulance crew lost the keys to their vehicle .
the service says it 's down to an increased workload and only represents a fraction of the cases they deal with .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln .
hope here , ready to bring you all the latest from across the county .
we 'll have news , travel , sport and weather updates through the day .
is there something we should know about ?
well we love to hear from you , so get in touch through email , facebook or twitter .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me and the team for today , we 'll be back tomorrow with more of the very latest across the county .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good weekend .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: tonight 's headlines with @ twitterid at 1830 on bbc one .
surely old headlines already broadcast today and possibly yesterday ?
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: north east lincolnshire council to introduce fortnightly bin collections
text: north east lincolnshire council has voted in favour of introducing fortnightly bin collections .
it 's believed the changes will save the council around four hundred thousand pounds .
people against the plans have said they 're furious , with some saying they 've lost confidence in the council .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: lincoln city fans say security checks were 'inappropriate '
text: you may remember that last week grimsby town fans alleged that female spectators were asked to show their bras to stewards during security searches at stevenage .
well now some lincoln city fans say they too have been subjected to inappropriate searches - when they faced mansfield away last night .
jonathan bellshaw went to watch the game , he says women were n't given the option to be searched by female staff - and one official joked about a bomb while searching a child :
searches need to be done in a proper way .
if you 're going to search kids there 's a way to do it and that is first asking the consent of the parent and tell the kids what 's going on you certainly do n't make jokes about bombs ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: man dies after accident near grantham
text: a man has died after an accident on the a52 near grantham .
it happened on monday at 17:30 in haceby and involved a motorbike and a car .
a woman in her 40 's was injured in the collision .
a 30-year-old man has been arrested on sus of leaving the scene of a road traffic collision .
the police are appealing for witnesses .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: plans for go-ape given approval in north lincolnshire
text: plans for a new go ape activity centre in north lincolnshire have been given the go ahead .
go ape will be built at normanby hall .
the tree top adventure course , with zip wires and rope swings , could create around 30 jobs at normanby hall country park next year .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'number of factors ' behind delay in death registrations
text: more now on the news that more than half of deaths in lincolnshire are n't being registered within the five-day target .
lincolnshire county council say a number of factors can delay registering a death - including some offices operating part-time .
the general register office says it 's working with councils to reduce delays by improving links between organisations like the coroner 's offices and gps .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: protests outside north east lincolnshire council over refuse collections
text: a protest has begun outside the north east lincolnshire council offices in grimsby over planned cuts to bin and library services .
the council wants to replace the weekly service with fortnightly refuse collections , to try and save more than £ 400,000 .
a decision on the future of collection services will be made later today .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather watchers : good weather for ducks
text: overcast with showers as a forecast may be a bit of a pain for us but these lot in sleaford do n't seem to mind :
thanks for melodysk for sending it in .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: deaths not registered quickly enough in lincolnshire
text: the majority of deaths in lincolnshire are n't being registered within the legal five day time limit .
figures obtained by the bbc show that it 's dropped from 68 % to 46 % in the last five years .
nationally the number of delayed notifications has been growing as well .
the delays mean that some families are having to wait longer to arrange funerals .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: drink-drive officer sacked from lincolnshire force
text: a lincolnshire police officer has been dismissed from the force after crashing her car into a dyke in saltfleetby while drunk and off-duty .
pc rebecca stevenson , 33 , who was based in louth , was over two times the legal alcohol limit when she lost control of her vehicle on the way to a caravan site on the lincolnshire coast .
a misconduct hearing at lincolnshire police headquarters in nettleham heard that she was found `` staggering '' in the street wearing only her dressing gown in the early hours of 2 july .

stevenson , who 'd worked as an officer for almost 12 years , told the hearing she was `` genuinely appalled '' by her behaviour but promised it was an `` isolated incident '' which would never happen again .
but lincolnshire police chief constable bill skelly said she could n't remain on the force :
i can not find what you did consistent with your role as a warranted officer .
both yourself and members of the public were at serious risk of suffering life changing harm or death ''
stevenson had pleaded guilty to drink driving when she appeared before nottingham magistrates on 18 july .
she was banned from driving for 17 months and given a £ 500 fine .
author: Jake Zuckerman
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: almost 150 lincolnshire police officers physically attacked in last two years
text: almost 150 lincolnshire police officers were physically attacked while working in the county in the last two years , new figures have revealed .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: the headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : wet in waltham
text: well it 's fair to say the recent run of nice weather has petered out .
but you do n't need gorgeous sunsets or blue skies to be a good weather watcher .
user ar took this in waltham and it 's a cracker :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: the weather this lunchtime
text: generally cloudy , with outbreaks of rain possible through the day , some becoming locally heavy before clearing from the west during the evening .
it will feel noticeably cooler than of late , especially further south .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: police fears over football match smoke bomb
text: you may have seen that a blue smoke bomb was thrown onto the pitch just before the full-time whistle in lincoln city 's saturday game against carlisle .
the police have just issued a statement saying that it could have been a very dangerous situation had it landed in the crowd .
it 's a crime to take a flares or smoke bombs into a football ground - some of the pyrotechnics contain dangerous chemicals and burn at incredibly high temperatures .
assistant chief constable shaun west oversees the lincoln city home games , he says the force takes it very seriously :
if this had landed in the crowd it could have caused panic and we could have had a real problem on our hands ''
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: protests over bin collection plans in north east lincolnshire
text: there 'll be protests today as north east lincolnshire council decides whether to change how often bins are collected and how long libraries are open for .
the council wants to replace the current weekly refuse collection service with fortnightly collections in a bid to save more than £ 400,000 a year .
today 's cabinet meeting will also look at plans to reduce library opening hours .
a protest against the plans will take place outside the meeting .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: thousands respond to louth cattle market plans
text: just over 3,000 people have responded to a consultation on the future of lincolnshire 's last remaining cattle market .
three options are being considered for louth livestock auction - to keep it , close it or move it .
there 's a week left for you to have your say and the leader of east lindsey district council craig leyland says they want as many responses as possible :
there 's a huge emotional attachment to this , there 's also a practical side to it .
the executive board at eldc needs to know the implications and repercussions of any decision we make ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police have recovered these items - do you recognise any of them ?
text: cambridgeshire police have recovered jewellery and other items and suspect some of it may have been stolen from properties across lincolnshire .
there 's certainly a lot of it !
take a look and see if any of it belongs to you :
they 'd like you to get in touch by sending an email .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: fault identified with renowned world war two aircraft
text: it made national news two weeks ago when it was revealed the battle of britain memorial flight ( bbmf ) had been grounded because of an unnamed fault .
the vintage aircraft based at raf coningsby had to cancel airshow appearances as a result .
well the ministry of defence ( mod ) says they 've now identified the problem - a faulty pinion gear in one of the merlin engines .
they 're now checking the others to make sure they do n't have the same issue .
each pinion gear is being inspected to confirm it meets our exacting standards .
the bbmf are putting all of our efforts into getting these beautiful aircraft safely back in the air as soon as possible ''
the bbmf were due to perform at the first ever scampton airshow which is being held the weekend after next .
however it 's not yet clear if the aircraft will be ready in time .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: fire chiefs probe burgh le marsh blaze
text: fire crews were called to burgh le marsh in the early hours of this morning to tackle a blaze at a derelict building .
at its height , crews from skegness , wainfleet and spilsby were involved but that 's since been scaled down .
lincolnshire fire and rescue service says the cause of the fire is under investigation .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: three million boost in visitor numbers to lincolnshire
text: visitor numbers are continuing to rise in lincolnshire .
latest figures show the county attracted 20 million people last year - up by nearly three million since 2011 .
the tourism industry is now worth a whopping £ 1.37bn .
the county councillor in charge of tourism , colin davie , says it 's down to a number of things :
the work done by tourism bodies throughout the county has helped and also the power of social media and the internet .
it 's helped to tell the story of why lincolnshire is wonderful and why people should visit .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: change coming down the tracks for rail services ?
text: you 're being asked for your views on one of the county 's main rail services .

the current franchise for the east midlands is due to come to an end next year and the department for transport is holding a series of consultations on the existing cross-country service run by stagecoach .
the first event takes place in lincoln today .
dave harby , chairman of the lincolnshire branch of rail future , says the region would benefit from more frequent trains .
lincoln to grimsby is n't even every two hours .
lincoln to doncaster only has five trains a day .
we want to see hourly services .
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: another rather drab day for most of us .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning , welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln .
alex here , ready to bring you all the very latest from across the county .
we 'll have news , travel , sport and weather updates throughout the day so check back to see what 's new .
is there something we should know about ?
get in touch through email , facebook or twitter .

BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's all from me and the team today , we 'll be back with more of the very latest from 08:00 tomorrow .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: here 's peter levy with tonight 's headlines :
tonight 's news headlines with @ twitterid - more on bbc one at 1830 .
army veteran should get in touch with veterans association uk ( vauk ) they will give her all the help she needs
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: the weather this evening
text: any evening brightness will be short-lived , as it becomes cloudy everywhere overnight with an increasing chance of outbreaks of rain returning .
although this will initially be light , some heavier rain is possible towards dawn .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: steampunk festival 'not getting enough council support '
text: more now on the lincoln steampunk festival held over the bank holiday weekend .

it 's thought to be the biggest event of its kind and is understood to generate up to £ 2.5m for the local economy , but organisers say that the city of lincoln council could do more to help them out .
director john naylor says it is in danger of becoming a victim of its own success :
it 's getting too big in many ways , we do n't get any public funding or anything to do it .
the majority of the festival is paid for by the event wristbands and we have to spend a lot of money on first aid and ambulances just for members of the public who have come to watch ''
the city of lincoln council says it 's surprised to hear the criticism , as they 've never been asked for more funding or support .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: former clergyman admits abuse charges
text: a former clergyman has admitted a series sex offences against under-age girls in lincolnshire .
john bailey , 76 , from kippax , leeds , admitted 25 charges of indecent assault on girls under the age of 14 .
bailey was granted conditional bail until 21 september at lincoln crown court .
he was first arrested as part of lincolnshire police 's operation redstone which followed a review of past safeguarding cases by the diocese of lincoln .

documents.title: grimsby town supporters ' anger over stevenage fc response
text: grimsby town supporter 's group , the mariners trust , has published a tweet that stevenage fc wo n't speak directly to them after they raised concerns about some of the security checks directed at female supporters .
the mariners trust made the allegations about the treatment of some female fans after the two sides met on saturday 19 august .
at the time stevenage fc said it implemented `` a full , 100 % compliant , searching regime '' after fears of `` the potential for anti-social and uncooperative behaviour '' .
they have instead contacted officials at grimsby town and asked them to keep the response confidential - and away from the supporters who complained ''
we 've been informed by stevenage fc they wo n't be replying to us directly about any of our complaints # gtfc
ffs do n't you think there 's more things to worry about in this sad mad world ?
let it go and move on and concentrate on the football
aw didums does this show your club in a bad light ?
wait until it happens to you and your wife and kids then u might see why people are angry
never going to happen to my wife or children cos im not stupid enough to let it happen for the sake of a football match so stop ur crying
so possible sexual assaults are n't important ?
'possible ' or 'alleged ' ?
the devil 's in the detail my fishy friends
both .
oh dear , this one 's going nowhere fast .
possible that some elements of the complaints gave led to police investigation ?
if so then probably right to keep quiet for now
we are not aware this is the case .
so @ twitterid have asked @ twitterid to keep their response confidential .
will # gtfc be doing so ?
it 's been raised at board level .
give us/the club some time on this one
nothing to do with which club you support.frankly amazed that some people are complaining about us whining or that it does n't matter .
to be honest we 're astonished at some of the comments we 've had from stevenage fans .
ca n't believe # gtfc fans would behave in same way .
it comes down to the north south divide it 's absolutely disgusting it boils down to .
northern neanderthals get what they deserve
well i 'm a southerner masquerading as a northerner so to them .
have you considered civil action ?
they would have to respond to that .
also how are @ twitterid responding to you ?
believe some supporters maybe considering legal action .
gtfc very supportive of us .
that is a disgrace - how can a football club do this .
i wonder if there is a potential litigation either with steward , or police that 's why
we 're not aware this is the reason why they wo n't communicate with us directly .
maybe you 'd have seen a response if you could be trusted not to use it in another publicity stunt .
maybe a lesson for you to learn there .
let 's see what the efl says , eh ?
author: Phillip Norton
BBC News

documents.title: rescued seals donald and dennis head back to sea
text: now you may remember back in january two seal pups were washed up on the east coast after a tidal surge .
luckily they were rescued by the natureland seal sanctuary in skegness who 've been looking after them - fattening them up until they were ready to be released .
they named them dennis and donald , the latter being named after us president donald trump because of his blonde hair .
well today was the big day and it was time for them to go back into the sea , take a look :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : bank holiday sunsets
text: were n't we lucky with the weather for once ?
the weather watchers have been busy , take a look at how they ended the day .
first to bourne where bourneeye captured this :
lincolnshire john snapped these wispy clouds in somersby :
and finally kirkby on bain where fiona captured this stunning sky :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: in supercars and historic aircraft at props and pistons 2017
text: thousands of car and aviation enthusiasts have attended the seventh props and pistons event in lincolnshire over the bank holiday .
author: Lincolnshire Reporter

documents.title: paddleboarding comes to lincolnshire 's waterways
text: there 's always something new to do in lincolnshire and now paddleboarding is the latest sport you can take up in the county !
i went to anton gowt near boston and had a go and surprisingly did n't fall in !
take a look :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: have you lost a puppy ?
text: east lindsey council say they 've found a young puppy at ingoldmells park and they want his owner to get in touch :
puppy found in an ingoldmells park , male cross breed , about 8-10 weeks old , black .
please call 01507 601111 , ref ehds/07132/17
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: could go-ape be coming to north lincolnshire ?
text: plans for go ape a new visitor attraction for north lincolnshire , will be examined by the local council this week .
the tree top adventure course , with zip wires and rope swings , could create around 30 jobs at normanby hall country park next year .
there are already 30 similar high rope adventure sites around the country , with the nearest currently at sherwood forest in nottinghamshire .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: red arrows to tour the middle east
text: it 's been announced the lincolnshire based red arrows will tour the middle east next month .
the defence secretary sir michael fallon says the team will help promote the uk 's long-standing relations across the gulf .
displays will be in held in jordan , saudi arabia , kuwait , qatar , oman and bahrain .
the tour will highlight the partnership with the british armed forces in each nation visited , as well as demonstrating that the uk is open for business ''
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: the headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: police still at the scene of mablethorpe stabbing
text: the scene this morning on victoria street in mablethorpe where yesterday a man was stabbed and killed .
a man in his 40 's remains in custody after being arrested shortly after the incident which happened at about 13:00 .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: fixed odds betting machines took £ 13.5m in lincolnshire last year
text: figures show that just 325 machines in the county took millions of pounds from punters last year with the machines making over £ 90m since 2008 .
fixed odds betting terminals ( fobts ) simulate games like roulette or blackjack and allow gamblers to bet £ 100 every 20 seconds .
the group campaign for fairer gambling want the maximum stake bringing down to £ 2 saying the machines are posing a real problem for addicted gamblers .
matt zarb-cousin is from the organisation and used to be addicted to fobts .
mr zarb-cousin said the machines raise an issue that needs addressing :
i got addicted aged 16 and over a period of about four years i lost about £ 20,000 and came close to taking my own life .
some 43 % of fixed-odds gamblers are addicted or classed as at-risk so it suggests there 's a big problem with this product ''
last year a cross-party group of mps urged the government to drop the maximum stake .
a review of the proposal is due in october .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire army veteran 'left with ptsd '
text: wragby army veteran kelly layden-farrer says she 's been left without proper care for a case of post traumatic stress disorder .
she says she 's been caught out by a loophole in the system - take a look :
author: Nicola Gilroy
BBC Look North

documents.title: lincoln auctioneer enjoys a successful endeavour
text: when you 're an auctioneer you 're never quite sure what 's going to end up under your hammer next but even the most experienced gavel-basher probably would n't expect this
this is a replica of captain james cook 's hm bark endeavour and unique auctions in lincoln sold it for £ 110,000 !
it 's currently a museum berthed on the river tees at stockton-on-tees - near to cook 's birthplace - and has now been sold to a buyer in the north east .
darryl kirk 's from the auction house and he said there had been a lot of interest :
we had interest locally in lincoln , we had interest in australia and interest from a prince in the middle east as well .
unfortunately he was too late to bid but yes , people were very interested . ''
better luck next time your highness !
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: woman suffers sex attack in lincoln
text: a woman has been sexually assaulted on lincoln high street in the early hours of monday .
the man approached the victim around 03:10 before sexually assaulting her .
police believe the attacker may have harassed other women in the area .
the attacker is black , in his mid 30 's , of slim build and around 6ft tall with short black hair , a short beard and a moustache .
he was wearing a black and red checked shirt .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire act rocks introducing stage at leeds and reading festival
text: two of the biggest events in the music calendar took place over the bank holiday weekend , the leeds and reading festivals .
lincolnshire was well represented at both by the immensely talented anna straker who grew up in lincoln and was a pupil at both william farr and lincoln minster school .
she wowed the crowds at the bbc introducing stage which supports unsigned musicians from across the uk .
take a look and a listen :
author: BBC Introducing

documents.title: man dead after being stabbed in mablethorpe
text: a man in his 30s has died after being stabbed on victoria road in mablethorpe yesterday .
police say a man in his 40s was arrested shortly after the incident , which happened at about 13:00 .
he remains in police custody .
they said that despite `` officers and paramedics best efforts '' the victim died at the scene .
i would like to reassure local residents that incidents of this nature are exceptionally rare .

it is critical that anyone who saw what happened or has knowledge about what may have led to this happening gets in touch with us as soon as possible - your information could prove crucial to our investigation .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire
